subject: Creativity
title: The Blank Canvas Myth: Constraints Fuel Creativity
description: A quick win: understand The Blank Canvas Myth: Constraints Fuel Creativity.

hook.text: 'Do anything you want.' These are the five most paralyzing words for a creator. Total freedom kills creativity.

buildup.text: Dr. Seuss wrote 'Green Eggs and Ham' using only 50 different words â€” a bet with his publisher.

discovery.text: Research confirms: when given unlimited options, people produce less creative work.

twist.text: Twitter's 140-character limit (now 280) forced concise, creative writing.

climax.text: IKEA's flat-pack constraint (everything must ship flat) drove radical furniture design innovation that wouldn't exist.

punchline.text: Freedom is overrated. Give a creative person a box, and they'll build something.

quiz.question: How many different words did Dr. Seuss use in 'Green Eggs and Ham'?
